page.title: 11FLORA
page.content: Disregarding the Holbury development which entroaches on this area,the region divides into 2 main sections each of which displays a fairly distinct flora. i) Acid heathland interposed with marsh and bogs. ii) Most fertile barton clays and sands. i) The most prevalent plants are heathers ( erica cinerea ) is already flowering and ling ( callura vulgaris) will soon be blooming. Also very frequently seen is Gorse (ulex europaeus ).Pregrowth tends to be stunted though there are small examples of siver Birch and Alders. Commen small plants and flowers at this times are the tormentil (potentill and erecta) heath bedstraw (galium saxatile) and common centaury(centaurium erythraea).
